identificationModule.briefTitle: FeNO After Hypoxia in Asthma Patients
identificationModule.officialTitle: Effects of Intermittent Hypoxia on the Asthmatic Inflammation of Asthma Patients - a Pilot Study

collaborators.name: Ludwig Boltzmann Institute for Lung Vascular Research

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
Stable Asthma patients (GINA 1-2) stay 6 days in a row for 4 hours per day in a hypoxic chamber simulating 2800m above sea level. Study participants will be blinded to the treatment given and divided into a hypoxic and a sham group (about 360m above sea level).

Effects of this intermittent hypoxia on the asthmatic inflammation of these patients will be measured. The primary endpoint is the change in forced exhaled nitric oxide (FeNO) before and after the study. Secondary endpoints include blood parameters, lung function testing and questionnaires.

armGroups.label: hypoxia
armGroups.description:
The hypoxia group receives normobaric hypoxic air while sitting in a hypoxic chamber simulating 2800 meter above sea level.

Interventions: hypoxia in hypoxic chamber, asthma and Quality of Life Questionnaires, lung function testing, blood taking, FeNO measurement, pulse oximetry
interventionNames: Other: Asthma and Quality of Life Questionnaires

armGroups.label: sham hypoxia
armGroups.description:
The sham group receives normal air while sitting in a hypoxic chamber in about 360 meter above sea level (Graz, Austria).

Interventions: sham hypoxia in hypoxic chamber, asthma and Quality of Life Questionnaires, lung function testing, blood taking, FeNO measurement, pulse oximetry
interventionNames: Device: sham hypoxia in hypoxic chamber
Other: Asthma and Quality of Life Questionnaires

interventions.name: hypoxia in hypoxic chamber
interventions.description: Intervention lasts 4 hours per day for 6 days in a row.

interventions.name: sham hypoxia in hypoxic chamber
interventions.description: Intervention lasts 4 hours per day for 6 days in a row.

interventions.name: Pulse oximetry
interventions.description: Pulse oximetry will be performed hourly during sessions in the hypoxic chamber for safety reasons.

interventions.name: Asthma and Quality of Life Questionnaires
interventions.description: Before every session in the hypoxic chamber as well as on the day after the last session will be completed.

interventions.name: Lung function testing
interventions.description: On the day of the first session in the hypoxic chamber as well as on the day after the last session lung function testing will be performed.

interventions.name: Blood taking
interventions.description: On the day of the first session in the hypoxic chamber as well as on the day after the last session blood samples will be taken.

interventions.name: FeNO measurement
interventions.description: Before every session in the hypoxic chamber as well as on the day after the last session FeNO (forced exhaled nitric oxide) measurement will be performed.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in forced exhaled nitric oxide after 6 days of hypoxia/sham
primaryOutcomes.description: Forced exhaled nitric oxide will be measured every day before and after the treatment

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in blood parameters after 6 days of hypoxia/sham
secondaryOutcomes.description: Blood parameters including c-reactive protein, complete blood cell count, total immunoglobulin e (IgE), specific IgE of seasonal inhalative antigens and eosinophilic cationic protein will be measured. Blood samples will be taken before the first and after the last intervention

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in lung function parameters after 6 days of hypoxia/sham
secondaryOutcomes.description: Lung function testing will be performed before the first and after the last intervention

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Quality of Life and Asthma questionnaires after 6 days of hypoxia/sham
secondaryOutcomes.description: Questionnaires include Asthma Control Test, Asthma Quality of Life Questionnaire, Asthma Control Questionnaire, a quality of life questionnaire and the Asthma Control Diary. Documents will be collected every day before the intervention
Finger pulse oximetry will be measured hourly during the intervention for safety reasons.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* stable Asthma (GINA 1-2)

Exclusion Criteria:

* autoimmune disease
* unstable Asthma (GINA 3-4)
* history of pneumonia/fever within 3 months
* place of residence \>1000m above sea level
* trip/vacation above \>2500m within 4 weeks
* cystic fibrosis
* diabetes mellitus
* immunodeficiency
* atopic dermatitis
* ciliary dyskinesia
* pregnancy
* chronic obstructive pulmonary disease
* history of smoking (\>1py)
* immunosuppression / systemic corticosteroids within 3 months
* cardiovascular diseases
* interstitial lung disease
* bronchopulmonary dysplasia

overallOfficials.name: Horst Olschewski, MD, Prof.
overallOfficials.affiliation: Medical University of Graz, Department of Internal Medicine, Division of Pulmonology
